bibl.title: Letter from [John H. Andrus] to John D. Schwieger, July 1, 1937

div1.p: [Andrus?] reports to Schwieger that his letter to Lambert was returned and that he is worried about him.

div1.head: Letter from [John H. Andrus] to John D. Schwieger, July 1, 1937
div1.opener:
From Mrs Ames
J.H. Andrus
805 Cooper St.
Camden, N.J.
7-1-37
Dear Schweig:
div1.p:
Am enclosing a letter - with
copies of others - which I
mailed to our friend, Lambert
a few days ago and which was
returned this morning marked:
“Moved - Left no address.”

If you know his new address
and will see that he gets
this matter shall appreciate
it very much.

I sincerely hope that nothing
regretable has happened to
Lambert but feel rather
apprehensive.
